As a result of the shelling, a fire broke out and ammunition began to detonate. Photos and videos of the explosions have surfaced on social media.

Ushomyr military unit in the Zhytomyr region was attacked by Russian troops. This was reported in Facebook Korosten Mayor Vladimir Moskalenko.

In a special video message, he clarified that after the shelling at the ammunition depots, a fire broke out in the unit, which led to detonation.

Moskalenko stressed that the range of the shells stored in the unit does not pose a threat to the city. Earlier, the General Staff removed long-range missiles.

“There are explosions of shells that are placed in the military unit,” the mayor said and urged residents not to panic, and also to avoid the surrounding areas.

Recall that as a result of a Russian strike on a military unit in the village of Lipetskoye, Odessa region, 22 people were killed.



Air defense shot down a Russian missile near Vinnitsa



News from Perild.com in Telegram. Subscribe to our channel

Enemy shelling continues in Zhytomyr region near Korosten. This was reported by Korosten Regional State Administration (RSA).



Now it is known about the shelling of a military unit in Ushomyr. Explosions can also be heard near Korosten.



People are urged to go to bomb shelters.



"Dear residents of Korosten district! A military unit in Ushomyr is being shelled. There are also explosions near the city. Be careful. Urgently all to the bomb shelters!" - it is stated in the message of the RSA.



We recall, today at 8 am the enemy has already fired military unit in Ushomyr.

Las imágenes de un video casero en el distrito de Obolon, un suburbio de Kiev, se volvió viral en las últimas horas por lo impactante: un tanque ruso aplastó un auto, pero el ocupante de este sobrevivió milagrosamente al ataque.

La secuencia muestra cómo el vehículo de guerra se desplazaba por una ruta principal que atraviesa la zona residencial. En ese momento el tanque se acercó rápidamente al auto que circulaba en dirección contraria. Giró bruscamente hacia él y le pasó por encima, sin dar tiempo al conductor de reaccionar.

En otros videos se ve cómo se acercan vecinos a intentar sacar de entre los hierros retorcidos al hombre, que estaba consciente en el vehículo.

Esto ocurrió mientras las tropas rusas se acercaban a la capital ucraniana después de que el presidente Vladimir Putin ordenó la invasión a gran escala a Ucrania.

#ATENCIÓN: Un hombre sobrevive de milagro luego que su vehículo fuera #aplastado por un #tanque de guerra en el óblast de Kiev.

Guerra Ucrania – Rusia#RussiaUkraineConflict#RussiaInvadedUkraine pic.twitter.com/AsyF5PM45E — Riobamba digital (@DigitalRiobamba) February 25, 2022

*El Grupo de Diarios América (GDA), al cual pertenece El Nacional, es una red de medios líderes fundada en 1991, que promueve los valores democráticos, la prensa independiente y la libertad de expresión en América Latina a través del periodismo de calidad para nuestras audiencias.

Войната в Украйна продължава да отнема животи, въпреки, че властите в Москва и Зеленски обявиха, че са склонни да преговарят.

Социалните мрежи позволяват ужаса на агресията да достигне до нас, повече от всякога. Точно такива са следващите истории от войната, които показват нейното лице.

Украинка изуми хората по света със своята храброст, след като се изправи срещу руски войник и му предложи слънчогледови семки - за да цъфтят, когато той умре.

„Вземете тези семена и ги сложете в джобовете си, така че поне слънчогледите да пораснат, когато всички легнете тук“, се чува да казва тя.

На друго краткото видео, разпространено от беларуския журналист Франак Виачорка, се забелязва как руски танк, движейки се по пътя, внезапно променя траекторията си, за да смачка умишлено задалия се насреща цивилен автомобил.

За огромен късмет по-късно се оказва, че шофьорът от смачкания автомобила е жив и здрав и се опитват да го извадят от колата му.

In Ukraine, a Russian tank had driven over the civilian car. Terrifying footage. My thoughts are with the people of Ukraine. pic.twitter.com/hmIDNCUeus
